data.title: New York Islanders 2012-13 Schedule Released: Open in Pittsburgh, Home Opener vs. Flyers
data.meta_description: The New York Islanders 2012-13 schedule opens against Atlantic Division rivals in Pittsburgh and home to the Flyers, the first of 16 back-to-backs on the season.
data.text:
Today the New York Islanders 2012-13 schedule "dropped," as the young folk say, revealing an opening weekend with back-to-back games against Atlantic Division Pennsylvania rivals.

Things kick off with the season opener against the Penguins in Pittsburgh Friday, Oct. 12. No rest for the weary, the Islanders then host the Philadelphia Flyers the next night for the Islanders home opener. That's part of 16 back-to-back occasions the Islanders will have this year.

The first meeting with the Rangers is Nov. 13 at the Coliseum. Official announcement is here, with full schedule here (and also posted below the jump on this page). A little later today, visit On The Forecheck for Dirk Hoag's ever-popular "Super Schedule" collating (it's up now) each team's back-to-backs and total travel miles.

The Isles schedule includes several traditional games around holidays and matinees -- including the night before U.S. Thanksgiving, consecutive nights after Christmas and day games on Presidents and Martin Luther King Jr. days. The California swing is Nov. 6-10 and includes weekend dates in Anaheim and San Jose.

The Islanders finish up at home April 13 against the Devils. Will a playoff spot be on the line?
